medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptom onset was noted at 11:30 PM the previous night after awakening to feed his child with mild periumbilical pain. By 6 AM, the patient experienced severe pain at the same location and nausea. Pain continued to increase until presentation to urgent care at 11 AM, with peak pain reported. Morphine was administered at noon in urgent care leading to significant pain relief, though pain returned to severe levels by 3 PM during transport to the ED, especially with bumps.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral hand surgery as a child; no significant past medical history.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandfather with history of colon and prostate cancers. No history of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
